group_1.narration: I had a dream…
It was a dream where@I successfully committed suicide…@about the world after I was gone.
Nothing changed in that world…@It didn't seem like anything@got better or worse.
All that irrational pain still existed…@but there was also kindness all around me@that I didn't notice back when I had decided to die.
The reason "we" didn't notice kindness@was because it had never been shown to us…@because we thought it had never been shown to us…
But…@But…

group_1.textCenter: (...Rika kept me company until I fell asleep.)

group_1.narration: I know kindness now@because Rika taught me.
The kindness she taught me broadened@my outlook and allowed me to see@all the other kindnesses that@flourish around me.
Like, the kindness of my parents,@which I'd always taken for granted@without noticing it…

group_1.textCenter: (I'm glad I called her last night…)

group_1.narration: I'm sure now…that when I said@"I don't want to die,"@I was hoping…
I was hoping that the world@I had been born into wasn't@as cold as I had known.
Deep down, I knew there had to be@wonderful things out there,@and I didn't want to die@without ever knowing them.
I just wanted a simple, endlessly@gentle ordinary life…

group_1.textCenter: (So when I discovered that there were Witches…)

group_1.narration: I thought that it meant there really were@no bad people at heart. I and the others who@committed suicide— the ones mentioned in@yesterday's news— would be freed from@the source of their unhappiness.

group_1.textCenter: (But coldness and irrationality are inherent@parts of the world.)

group_1.narration: I couldn't accept that,@and despairing over the world,@I again wanted to die,
because I was convinced kindness@didn't exist.
I know for sure that I won't ever@make a third attempt,
because I've already received@more of an outpouring of kindness@from others than I could ever hold.
They taught me that as cold and@irrational as this world is,@there is warmth all the same.

group_1.textCenter: (And that's why I want to share my kindness@now…)
(With those who are in despair over the world@and are about to give up on it…)
(So I can help them feel like…they don't@have to give up…)
(I want to give others the kindness that@was shared with me…)
(I'm sure that's what I wanted to know@when I wished not to die.)

group_1.narration: I don't want to end up in despair@over this place I was born into.
With that, I finally understood the meaning@of the plea I had wished for in that moment.
…Though maybe that meaning is something@I only came to understand after@meeting Rika and the others.
Looking back now, I think my original goal@as a Magical Girl still stands as an appropriate@one for the future.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah… thanks to you, I figured out@what I want to do.
I thought you might want to hear it…

group_1.narration: I told her about wanting to get rid of malice@in the world, and how I wanted@to help both those who are victims of it,@and those who have held it in their hearts.@I was terrible at speaking like always,@but Rika hung onto my every last word.

group_1.textLeft: I want to help people…who feel pain over@being alive…

group_1.textRight: That's just what I would expect from you!
I feel like this is a path that extends right@from your own experiences.
C'mon, let's go look up what kinds of jobs@or activities will help with that!
